page.title: 16Nercwys & Eryrys - History
page.content: There is some evidence of prehistoric remains in this area. The only recorded cairn is on Nercwys Mountain. Two fields called Cae y Garreg - Field of the Stone - suggest there had been standing stones. The name Gist Faen means stone chest, there is no trace of a stone now. In 1982 a Bronze Age axe with a gold ingot hidden in the socket and 2 gold bracelets were found on a ledge at Craig y Wolf, near Eryrys. These are now in the National Museum, Cardiff. Two small Flint instruments were found in the area in the 1970s Eryrys was originally known as Tre-yr-Yrys, later as Tre'r Yrys, possibly from the name Gyrys - a collector of welsh proverbs. Other explanations of the name are the word Eryr meaning eagle or Erw Rhys meaning Rhys's Acre.
